Start by calculating the percent daily values. Once you've done this, try to identify all the other foods and repeat this process; they should all be seven-letter words.

The number of Calories can actually be calculated from the nutrition facts. Look up how to do this rule. To check your understanding, see if you can rederive 213.88 figure from the numbers on the given label.
For every other food, you should now be able to compute the number of grams of protein using all the information. The corresponding number of grams will spell the answer.
